video_title: Singapore Semi-Lockdown Diary Day 0 | Japanese Living in SG
video_caption:
["This thing called the 'circuit breaker' is happening in Singapore. It's not actually a lockdown, but something similar. All non-essential shops will be closed and citizens are advised to stay home. It will last for about a month.

I decided to film how it's like here in Singapore.

video_title: Visiting The Last Surviving Village in Singapore | Kampong Lorong BuangkokğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Enable CC for English subtitles!
So today I visited Kampong Lorong Buangkok, the last remaining village in Singapore. I didn't know what to expect here, but I was amazed by what I saw.
Lady getting eggs from her chickens, 4 digit postal codes, unreliable locks on doors... I felt like I time traveled. Old Singapore was still there. I really enjoyed my time and I hope you do too. Personal must visit in Singapore!

Google Map of Kampong Lorong Buangkok:
", 'https://goo.gl/maps/Pq5C6wgX8dwRNKbE9', '

If you liked this video, please leave a thumbs-up and subscribe. Thank you.

video_title: Hawkers After the Lock Down | Old Airport Road Food Centre, Singapore
video_caption:
["I thought I should treat myself some amazing hawker food after the 3 month long semi-lockdown in Singapore. So I headed off to Old Airport Road Food Centre. It is one of the most popular hawker centre among the locals and it has over 150 stalls to choose from. Of course my main objective is to have delicious food. But today, I also wanted to show you what's around this area. Tourists only come here for the hawker centre. What else does this area have to offer? Join me on today's journey.

video_title: Japanese YouTuber Meets Dee Kosh | Famous Singapore YouTuberğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:

["Today we are going DEEP in Singapore's Little India! It's a vibrant, bustling neighborhood with culture, heritage and delicious food. Just aimlessly walking will take you to somewhere interesting. video_title: You Wouldn't Believe What's Inside This Box!
video_caption:
["We received a very special box from our Singaporean uncle, Ah Ku. At a glance, it looks like a treasure box. Elegantly orange and posh. What's inside? Gold? Diamond? Let's find out.

Singapore is in the midst of Mid-Autumn Festival. It celebrates the end of the autumn harvest with family gatherings, lanterns and mooncakes.

video_title: Does He Regret Being Half Singaporean/Japanese? His Take on National ServiceğŸ–ï¸
video_caption:
['Today I met a viewer who is half Singaporean & half Japanese who is currently serving National Service (military). He has an interesting profile - he lived outside of Singapore almost his whole life! Not many Japanese know Singaporean men who turned 18 have to serve the military. I myself did not know much about military either, so I decided to ask him some questions regarding NS. In return, I gave him a mini tour of China Town and made his stomach full with delicious local food.

video_title: What I Like and Always Missed About Japan | Japanese Guy Goes Home
video_caption:
['What I Like and Always Missed About Japan. 

Thanks Onoda-san for being in my video! You can check his channel from the link below.
', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bIsVt...', '

I came back to Osaka, Japan to visit my family. I lived in Japan for about 10 years and I will have to say that I was feeling quite neutral (slightly on the negative side) to my country. Of course there is no perfect country, so there are always positive and negative sides. But my overall impression was a bit negative. (Especially after working at a Japanese company. Oh man)

But I noticed maybe I was wrong. There are so many nice things about Japan, like conbini (convenience stores). I think Japan might have the best conbini in the world. It is just so fun to walk inside and buy some small munchies. I love it.

So in this video, I talked about what I like and missed about Japan. 

Table of Contentï¼š
1. The Supermarket is Amazingï¼ˆ', '0:38', '~ï¼‰
2. The Train in Japanï¼ˆ', '2:26', '~ï¼‰

9. Student Uniformï¼ˆ', '10:50', '~ï¼‰

Please leave a thumbs up and subscribe if you enjoyed it. Comment below on what would you like to see from me. Thanks for watching!

video_title: CARRYING YOU, Finger Style Guitar Cover Played in World Heritage Site| Laputa: Castle in the Sky
video_caption:
['This is my finger style guitar cover of CARRYING YOU, from the Ghibli Film "Laputa: Castle in the Sky".

This was filmed at Melakka, Malaysia. It is a world heritage site near Singapore, where I live. 
St. Paul Church was a perfect location to play Carrying You from Castle in the Sky, because the church resembles the film. Old and green, it will make you feel like you're walking in part of the film.']

video_title: KAZE NI NARU Finger Style Guitar Performance! From the Ghibli movie "The Cat Returns"
video_caption:
['Hi, Ghibli Ojisan here.

Today, I played "Kaze Ni Naru" from the Ghibli Studio movie "The Cat Returns". This is a finger style guitar cover.

Played in Sentosa, Singapore

* I did not collect money and only played for recreational purposes.']

video_title: This might make you NOT wanting to move to Singapore..
video_caption:
['House lizards (geckos).

Apparently, they appear quite often in Singapore HDBs and condos. They usually appear from surprise and are quite fast, so it scares the hell out of the local Singaporeans.

However, for a Japanese like me, I feel they are WAY better than cockroaches. In fact, If you look carefully, house lizards have cute faces  :)']

video_caption:

video_title: Japanese Son Cooks Takoyaki For Singaporean FamilyğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘§â€ğŸ‘§
video_caption:
["Today I'm attempting to cook authentic takoyaki for my Singaporean family. Almost all ingredients were bought from a Japanese supermarket in Singapore. Do you want to learn how to cook takoyaki? Do you want to see how my Singapore family react? Then why don't you join me in this takoyaki episode.Huat.

What you need:
- takoyaki machine 
This is the one I bought! ", 'https://shopee.prf.hn/l/7Bn3l4e', "
It's an affiliate link, meaning I will earn a small commission from the seller when you purchase.
- water
- eggs
- takoyaki batter mix (4SGD per pack which makes 32 takoyaki balls)
- green onions
- fish broth
- dried small prawns

We were really surprised how delicious are takoyaki balls were. If you are looking for something fun to do with your family, very recommended! Huat ah

video_title: Here's How My Property Viewing Wentâ€¦ğŸ’°ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ Foreigner Buying a Resale HDB in Singapore
video_caption:
["We are going to buy a resale HDB flat in Singapore! We've been actively looking for flats online and already did some viewings. Today, Wendy, a viewer of mine, asked me if I was interested in viewing her flat in Northern Singapore, Sembawang. Sembawang is only a few MRT stops to Yishun, one of my favorite neighborhoods. So why not? Join me on today's vlog of house-hunting in Singapore.

Thank you Wendy for letting me film this. You can contact Wendy via Instagram if you wish to view the unit. ", 'https://www.instagram.com/berry_i_hug...', '

video_title: We Found Our Dream House
video_caption:
['I had an opportunity to stay at this amazing apartment in Singapore. You will not believe how amazing the view is! You get an unblocked view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the sea. The location is also superb with City Hall, Clarke Quay/Boat Quay, Marina Bay Sands, Raffles Place and etc at a walking distance.
The price of the apartments start from 4,700SGD but if you mention you watched this video, you can enjoy special discounts.

video_title: Back to Singapore's Most Dangerous Hood
video_caption:
["So I came back to so-called Singapore's most dangerous area, Yishun. In the last video, many locals gave me advice on where to visit... So I went to some. I had amazing laksa and chicken rice and also met generous locals. Initially, I really thought this place was dangerous and scary. However, I learned that I was wrong. It's a delicious area. But PMDs and electric scooters can be deadly, so be careful!

Thank you for those giving me advices on where to visit. Looking forward to my next trip to Yishun!

video_caption:
['Enable cc for English subtitles! Japan's solo yakiniku chain "Yakiniku Like" is opening in Singapore! video_title: What did Japan do to Singapore? | Civilian War Memorial - Sook ChingğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["I'm Japanese and it is my first time visiting the Civilian War Memorial in Singapore. 
This tower was built in memory of the civilians killed during the Japanese occupation of Singapore during World War II. 
It was quiet and peaceful. Also near the city centre, so if you're Japanese, I recommend you visit. 
If you liked the video, please leave a thumbs up and subscribe. My goal is to show more of the hidden non-touristy side of Singapore. I appreciate your support.

Subscribe: ", 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', "

My Other Videos with English Subs: 
- Visiting Singapore's Most Dangerous Area: ", 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jOO7A...', '
- This is how Singapore looks like without makeup: ', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sb5Y3...', '

video_title: Why I'm Buying a House In One of Asia's Most Expensive Country
video_caption:
["Why am I buying a house in Singapore, South Eastern Asia's most expensive country? Flats here are not cheap, they tend to be small, and they are 99 year lease. So why? Find out in the first 10 seconds of this video! 

ğŸ˜ƒSubscribeï¼š ", 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', '
ğŸ¥Watch - Japanese YouTuber Meets Singapore Celeb | Sheikh HaikelğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ï¼š', 'https://youtu.be/e75wVbCfnkQ', '

FYI, there are three types of houses you can buy in Singapore.

1. HDB (Public housing)
2. Private Properties
3. Executive Condos (ECs)

I am going for the HDB because we are eligible to purchase under the Non-citizen spouse scheme. We are thankfully eligible for some grants too.

Follow me on social medias!

video_caption:
['A while back ago, I had an amazing bicycle trip in Hokkaido, Japan. I traveled around 600km in a week. It was by far the most amazing experience I had in Japan. The scenery, people and the food... everything was so magical. 
Most people only go to Sapporo, Otaru and Hakodate, but this huge prefecture of Japan has so much more to offer.

I hope this was interesting! You can watch the whole series from the playlist below. It has better graphics (4K) and un-cut scenes.

['Some of the Japanese call Singapore "bright North Korea." They think the two countries are similar in many ways. But is that true? In this video, I talked about my view as a foreigner (Japanese) living in Singapore for 1.5 years.

video_title: Accidentally Visiting the Haunted Road in SingaporeğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬Tampines Vlog
video_caption:
['Enable cc for English subtitles! On the previous video, I explored the centre of Tampines and met nice locals. But I felt like I needed to explore more of the old district. So in this video, I visited one of the oldest roads in Tampines only to find out it was haunted. If you are interested, google "Old Tampines Road".
Tell me in the comments if you saw a ghost but I sincerely hope I didn't film it!

video_title: Japanese Reviewing Singapore's Delivery Food ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬AMAZING Everything..
video_caption:
['Japanese living in Singapore reviews over 10 types of delivery food! Many of my viewers told me I should film and review the delivery food in Singapore, so here it is. Watch till the end and you will have a good idea what to order tomorrow!

', '1:38', '~ TOAST BOX. One of the most popular coffee chain in Singapore. Love their coffee and laksa. Available almost everywhere in SG.

', '6:29', '~ Ma Maison. A popular Japanese-Western & Tonkatsu restaurant from Nagoya, Japan. Nice, crispy tonkatsu and super buttery beef stroganoff. Here is the menu: ', 'http://www.ma-maison.sg/', '
* Available for takeaway (call beforehand) and delivery

', '10:45', "~ Chikuyotei. Traditional Japanese restaurant from Tokyo. I'm a big fan of their unagi, but I recommend the shabu shabu set. Affordable and delicious! Don't forget to order their shochu if you like drinking. Check out the menu here: ", 'https://www.facebook.com/chikuyoteisi...', "
* Available for takeaway (call beforehand) and delivery

Delicious food will lighten up your day! So do yourself a favor and order good food! Let's stay safe and keep postive. Huat AH!

video_title: Japanese Reacting to Chinese New Year in SingaporeğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Enable cc for English subtitles! I wasn't planning to film 2020 New Year's eve in Singapore but received some requests so here it is.How is it different and unique compared to Japan's New Years? By short,

Japan: Quiet and a lot of TV watching
Singapore: Loud and exciting

I love experiencing different cultures so I had a lot of fun. Lohei (or Yusheng) and Lion Dance are both traditional events held during the Chinese New Year (or Lunar New Year) in Singapore. The Lion Dance will be held at some malls even after the second day of Chinese New Year, so keep an eye out!

video_title: Possibly The Most Beautiful Town in Singapore | PUNGGOLğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
['Today, I visited the North-Eastern area of Singapore called Punggol. I took a walk to one of the HDB situated right next to the river. If you lived here, you can take a walk along the river everyday.. So nice. I also cycled to Punggol Beach, where Sook Ching took place.
Overall, beautiful town. The purple line of Punggol takes you to Dhoby Ghaut, ChinaTown and HarbourFront in 20-30minutes. Quite convenient!

If you want to take the same route as I did, you can check out Google Maps from the link below. I pinned the places I visited. Enjoy!
', 'https://drive.google.com/open?id=1AJz...', '

["What's the reality of working in Japan? Watch till the end to fully understand the beauty of being a salary-man.

", '0:05', '~ Bowing at the elevator
', '0:42', '~ Smoking Breaks
', '1:34', '~ Peer Pressure

video_title: I Want To Live Here | Tiong Bahru ExpeditionğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Today I visited Tiong Bahru district in Singapore for the first time. Tiong Bahru is one of the oldest estates in Singapore. You can feel the history and culture, and what's interesting is that it is also famous for hip cafes and shops. But what surprised me most was the air raid shelter at the basement of an HDB (Public housing). The monkey god temple was fascinating as well. Who knew Tiong Bahru had all of these?

", '00:45', ' | Where is Tiong Bahru? Briefing
', '02:15', ' | Sneaking Inside an old HDB
', '03:15', ' | Air Raid Shelter
', '04:31', ' | Passing by an old HDB
', '05:03', ' | Food Hunt at Tiong Bahru Food Hawker Centre
', '09:00', ' | Cafe Street

After a long stroll, I confirmed that Tiong Bahru has something more to offer than cool cafes. A must go spot in Singapore! Huat!!

video_title: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬Japanese Visiting Singapore's Most Dangerous Area | Yishun Vlog
video_caption:
["Please turn on cc for English subs! So today I went to Yishun which is known as one of the most dangerous area in Singapore. 
The locals know it for weird incidents happening all the time like cat-killings and random uncle knocking your door asking for your child. Some murders and suicide occurred too. 
Please like the video and subscribe for more of these videos. And I apologize if you are from Yishun (I don't mean to criticize your neighborhood; in the end I found it a nice cozy town :) )

Below Japanese:

video_caption:
['My dream came true; visiting a landed house in Singapore. The house I visited today is 14 million Singapore dollars which is around 10 million USD. Because Singapore is such a small country, land and houses are very expensive. 

ğŸ˜ƒSubscribeï¼š ', 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', "
ğŸ¥How It's Like Living in a HDB Flat | My Room TOURï¼š", 'https://youtu.be/pSwlm_6K9II', '

It was such a rare experience to take a peek of their life. A nice pool. plenty of rooms, a pet lobster,  a big cute dog and an amazing gaming room. 
Thank you Audrey and Haidee for letting me film the house! (Sorry I probably spelled your name wrong). Thank you Daiki-san for hooking us up.

If you are interested in purchasing this house, please drop me a DM on instagram. No trolls please!

video_caption:
['My dream came true; visiting a landed house in Singapore. The house I visited today is 14 million Singapore dollars which is around 10 million USD. Because Singapore is such a small country, land and houses are very expensive. 

ğŸ˜ƒSubscribeï¼š ', 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', "
ğŸ¥How It's Like Living in a HDB Flat | My Room TOURï¼š", 'https://youtu.be/pSwlm_6K9II', '

Thank you Audrey and Haidee for letting me film the house! (Sorry I probably spelled your name wrong). Thank you Daiki-san for hooking us up.

If you are interested in purchasing this house, please drop me a DM on instagram. No trolls please!

video_caption:
['Enable cc for English subtitles! So today I visited Tampines, one of the most livable area in Singapore. It is in the East and has a great access to the airport. It is one of the mature estate so I was thinking it was going to be a bit old, but I was wrong. It has super modern malls and even 2 theatres. The locals call the area "the Orchard Road of the East".
Overall I had a great time, but feel like something is missing. The next video will be me exploring the old area of Tampines. Please like the video if you enjoyed!

video_title: Maybe I Shouldn't Buy a House in Singapore
video_caption:
["I recently made a video about me buying an HDB flat in Singapore but I am now rethinking. Should I really buy a house here? Properties in Singapore are not cheap and they are 99-year leasehold most of the time. Aren't houses in Japan more affordable and a better choice? So in this video, I talked about my thinking process and compared the prices of properties in Singapore and Japan. It's exciting to think about buying a house but can be really stressful..

video_title: Why I Chose to Live and Buy a House in Singapore Over Japan
video_caption:
['After reconsideration, I decided to buy a flat and live in Singapore.

ğŸ”¥My live stream & food channel "Taberu Travel": Subscribe NOW for 3 live streams per week!
', 'https://www.youtube.com/c/TaberuOjisan', "

In the last video, I told you I was actually reconsidering living in Singapore because it seemed like Japan had cheaper houses. Plus, Japan has nice food and beautiful nature. But in the end, I chose Singapore over Japan. In this video, I compared Japan and Singapore's working culture, safety, cost of living, people & society, tax and education. 

Table of Contents
", '00:00', ' | Opening
', '00:52', ' | Safety

video_title: Do you really need to be able to speak English to get a job in Singapore?
video_caption:
['I have been getting a lot of these questions lately, so I decided to make a video.

There are MANY Japanese companies in Singapore and some of those companies do not require intense level of English. 

However, most of the time, you'll feel like you're working at Japan in these companies. Because everyone around you will be mostly Japanese and will work like a Japanese. (Long hours, too many meetings and etc.)

So my recommendation is, "Learn English first. Then Job hunt in Singapore".

Hope this video helped you!']

video_caption:
['Enable cc for English subtitles! One of the world's craziest condo "The Interlace" is located in Singapore. Take the 100/166/61/97 bus from HarbourFront, and you will reach this Jenga-like condo in 15 minutes. I've only seen it on social media and I have to tell you, it looks beautiful in real life!
Purchasing price starts from 1,200,000 ~ 5,000,000 SGD depending on the size and floor of the unit. Thank you Wee and Vivien for arranging this tour.

video_title: Can You Believe This is Singapore?ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬Changi VillageğŸŒ´
video_caption:
["Today I made my first visit to Changi Village, Singapore. It's a weekend hideout area first developed by the British. There are no villages currently but still can enjoy the tranquility and beautiful scenery. It's really a pity tourists don't come here (or know here). If I was a tour guide, I will definitely bring my group and let them enjoy great food at the hawker centre and treat them local brewed beer. A must-visit area in Singapore!

video_title: Cheapest Hair Cut In One Of Asia's Most Expensive Countryï½œ SingaporeğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ Vlog
video_caption:
['Turn on CC to enable English subtitles!
Singapore is known to be flashy and expensive among tourists. But as a Japanese living here, I noticed most of the locals here live a normal, humble life. 
So today I went to a hair salon called "Snip Avenue" in Hougang. I read an article that this was one of the cheapest salon in Singapore. (Although I found out it's not. Watch in the video!)
I got a haircut for only S$3.80. That's around 3USD. So cheap!
Overall, I'm quite satisfied with my hair, although I don't really look like a Singaporean. (I asked for "Singapore Style" haha)
I liked the friendly, local environment. In Japan, the cheapest you can get will be around S$7-12. Would cut my hair again for sure!

Subscribe: ', 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', '

video_title: 10 Things I Hate About Singapore
video_caption:
['After living in Singapore for a little over a year, I decided to share what I do not like about this country. I am sorry if I offend anyone, but this is my true feelings. Especially that bird. Why cry from 5am? Can you please be more considerate?
* This video was safely filmed. Do not try to do this at your home, it is dangerous.

video_title: I Went on a Date With My Mother in Law
video_caption:
["I hope me wife does not see this. Today, I went on a date with my Singaporean mother in law. Our plan is to eat nice ramen, have some kopi kopi and then enjoy shopping. Curious of how it went? Then why not join me as we enjoy our day at Paya Lebar. 
And don't forget to check out mom's inspirational quotes near the end!

Lunch at Ramen Keisuke Niku King was an invited media tasting hence we did not pay. Thank you Ramen Keisuke for the invitation.

video_title: This is Singapore Without Makeup. Japanese Exploring Local Area of Singapore[cc]
video_caption:
['Turn on cc for subtitles!
Too many Japanese tourists think Singapore = Marina Bay Sands and Orchard. Clean and rich. So in this video, I took an LRT from a residential area called "Sengkang" to show how the locals really live like.

video_title: Am I Breaking the Law?
video_caption:
["I stayed home in Singapore for 3 days and had to go outside to get some fresh air. But the big question is, am I breaking the law? You can get fined walking outside if you're not wearing a mask. But if you are jogging, it's okay not to wear them. But what if I'm taking short walking breaks during my jog? How do you guys cope with this? My impression of Singapore is no tolerance; so I wear my mask at all time.

video_title: Trying Singapore's Craziest CuisineğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
['Welcome to Geylang, Singapore. This area is known for many things, but one thing you can't miss out when you're here is the food. Geylang is a place to enjoy supper among the locals. One famous cuisine in Geylang is frog porridge. As a Japanese, "frog porridge" does not sound appetizing at all, but I thought I'd give it a try. Is it worth trying? Join me as I devour into Geylang's famous frog porridge.

video_title: ğŸ–ï¸World War 2 Survivor Opened This Shop in SingaporeğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ Balestier
video_caption:
["Today, I visited one of Singapore's oldest optic shops called Lim Kay Khee Optical and Contact Lens Centre. It is located at Balestier, a retro, old district in central Singapore.  The shop has a history that goes back to the 1930s. Super vintage and so many stories. Join me on today's journey of Balestier, Singapore.
Thank you Alvin, Norsaleen and Jiashi from NHB (National Heritage Board) for arranging our appointment. Thank you William and Karen for your time.

Here are more information about their project:
", 'https://www.aspirantsg.com/balestier-...', '

video_title: Making Every Singaporean's Dream Come True During Lock Down
video_caption:
["On April 22, most bubble tea shops closed down in Singapore. This brought grief to all Singaporeans. But don't worry, you can DIY your own bubble tea quite easiliy. All you need is tapioca starch, black sugar (or gula melaka), pandan leaf and water. However, it wasn't easy as I thought; it requires strength and time. It is a fun activity to do during a lock down though.

Find the recipe here:
", 'https://www.straitstimes.com/lifestyl...', '

video_title: Unveiling the Biggest Secrets of My Family's House in Singapore
video_caption:
["One day, I noticed there was a broken egg shell at the door. I also noticed there were red stickers all over the house. And even an ox sticker at the pantry. Why do my in-laws do these? Today, I asked my Singaporean mother in law and found out why. Very interesting indeed! I didn't know I was surrounded by prosperity every day!

video_title: Singapore's Delivery Food MUST EATS!!ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Another episode of a foreigner reviewing Singapore's delivery food during the semi-lockdown Circuit Breaker. It sucks being stuck at home all day, but ordering delicious food can lighten up your day. So treat yourself occasionally! Stay safe and healthy, Huat AH!

", '00:34', '~ Nam Kee Pau - One of my favorite pau chains in Singapore. Their shumai and big pau are must eats! Goes surprising well with coffee. Find them on Grab!

', '4:26', '~ Kushikatasu Tanaka - Deep fried skewer chain from Osaka, Japan. Their fresh and savory skewers are delicious! But it might be a better idea to re-fry them at home if they traveled a long distance. Order on their website. ', 'https://kushikatsutanaka.oddle.me/en_SG/', '

', '5:50', '~ D.Bespoke - A high end bar ranked 25th in Asia's 50 Best Bars. I got 3 of their shochu cocktails (60SGD each! I am sorry I made a mistake in video) and the amazing wagyu beef don! I really loved everything I had, but my choice is the "Shochu Hanky Panky". Check out their Facebook page for delivery instructions and the menu. ', 'https://www.facebook.com/dbespoke/', '
Their YouTube channel: ', 'https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaK0...', '

', '12:11', "~ Yakun Family Cafe - One of the most famous coffee chains in Singapore. I'm a big fan of Yakun's thick, aromatic coffee. If you haven't you have to try their steamed kaya bread. Incredibly fluffy and delicious. Find them on Grab!

Playing "Merry go round of Life", from the movie "Howl's Moving Castle." 
I filmed this in a small city called Colmar in Eastern France, near the German border.

The movie was actually inspired by the city's landscape, so it is a must-visit for fans. I really enjoyed walking by the colorful houses and it really felt I might encounter Sophie (the heroine) somewhere in the town.']

Playing "The Promise of the World", from the movie "Howl's Moving Castle." 
I filmed this in a small city called Colmar in Eastern France, near the German border.

The movie was actually inspired by the city's landscape, so it is a must-visit for fans. I really enjoyed walking by the colorful houses and it really felt I might encounter Sophie (the heroine) somewhere in the town.']

video_title: Would You Come Here? Crazy Ear Wax Removal in China Town, SingaporeğŸ‘©ğŸ»
video_caption:
["Today I decided to get my ear cleaned. I went down to China Town of Singapore, seeking for and affordable ear wax removal shop. After a stroll inside People's Park Complex, I found a shop with two friendly Chinese ladies. Price was 30 SGD (20 USD) for 30 minutes of ear cleaning. Lee Sei was such a friendly and highly skilled ear digger. I was shocked at how much ear wax I had! And the vibration thing was like WOW. Crazy Experience! 
Although it wasn't the cleanest shop, the whole thing was by far the most satisfying experience I had in Singapore. Watch till the end if you want to know how it's like getting your ear cleaned in Singapore! Huat!!

Shop name: Wellness Centre
Location: Peoples's Park Complex #03-52

Not a sponsored video. They are hard workers; Please tip them well if you are visiting!

video_title: Biggest Reason Why a 21 Year Old Japanese Female Came to Singapore
video_caption:
['Today, we will be interviewing Harupon-san who is working in Singapore. If you want to work in this country, this may be helpful.

Details about Harupon-san:
-21-year old female.
-Graduated from a vocational college and just entered the workforce.
-2nd year in Singapore.
-Working in a call centre.

I usually hear from my viewers the following:
Only a fresh graduate, but will I be able to find work in Singapore?
Is it okay even if I graduate from a vocational college?

These questions came in good timing since I was able to do an interview about this.

video_title: Japanese Son Tries Singaporean Mother in Lawâ€™s Signature Dish ğŸ‘©ğŸ»
video_caption:
['Today I followed my Singaporean mother in law to the wet market and filmed how she chooses her groceries and then cook her Signature Chinese-Hakka dish. She cooks for us everyday and I enjoy all her dishes but I never knew she put this much effort. Washing and soaking all the veggies! And even takes out all the black parts from the small prawns! I am sure your mom takes good care of you too so take the time to thank your mom too!! Huat!

video_title: Japanese Attempts to Cook Iconic Singaporean DishğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Watch a foreigner trying to cook Singapore's iconic dish Bakuteh. I attempted to recreate the famours SongFa bakuteh from scratch.

Check out crazybadmanâ€™s online shop!
", 'https://www.crazybadman.com/', "

Use coupon code â€œghibojisan10â€ to get 10% off your order. No minimum order, no limit on use! Letâ€™s stay healthy and active during this circuit breaker period! Huat AH!

Recipe of my bakuteh:
- pork ribs
- chicken feet
- chicken stock cube
- garlic (with skin)
- water
- salt
- white peppercorn
- black peppercorn
- cinnamon
- star anise

Bakuteh is a traditional Singaporean dish loved by locals and tourists. Other countries like Taiwan and Malaysia have their own style of bakuteh (tends to be herby and sweet). Singaporean bakuteh is known to be peppery and spicy. Locals love to eat it together with youtiao, or fried fritters. Can't wait for the Circuit Breaker to end and go get myself some SongFa bakuteh!

video_title: ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Japanese Explaining Singapore's Kiasu Culture
video_caption:
['Enable CC for English subtitles! Today I found something that resembles Singapore's national mentality/mindset, so I decided to make a video about it.
The word "Kiasu" comes from the Hokkien dialect, meaning "scared of losing". Singaporeans with this mindset will queue for hours when there are appealing sales going on. (And even for not-so-appealing sales)
But this Kiasu culture exists in a lot of other Asian countries. Even Japanese (especially Osakans) will queue long for saving a buck or two. However, Singaporeans take it to the next level.

Check out my food channel, Taberu Travel: ', 'https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuod...', '

video_title: Is Changi Airport Really Empty Right Now?
video_caption:
["Today, I made a visit to World's number one airport, Changi Airport in Singapore. People told me the airport and JEWEL are super empty. But is it really? 

ğŸ˜ƒSubscribeï¼š ", 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', '

Overall, it felt emptier than usual but definitely not a ghost town. But the business is not the best.
The canopy park at JEWEL is free to the public until the end of March and other attractions are 50% off. Let's support JEWEL and keep Singapore strong!

This is not a sponsored video.

video_title: I've Found Adult's Paradise | TanglinğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Welcome to Singapore's expat's town, Tanglin. It's an area that is near Orchard Road with lots of condos and nice-looking restaurants. But today I am here to introduce you to a Japanese retail shop called Kurara. Here at Kurara, you can find rare Japanese jun maishu (quality sake using only rice and water), delicious ice creams and beautiful Japanese antiques. If you love authentic Japanese products, you will love this shop! 

Details of Kuraraï¼ˆè”µæ¥½ï¼‰
- Address: 41 Tanglin Road Tudor Court, 247929 Singapore
- Hours: Everyday 12-8PM
- Facebook: ", 'https://www.facebook.com/kuraraSG/', '
- Instagram: ', 'https://www.instagram.com/kurara_sg/', '
- Order online: ', 'https://kurara.oddle.me/en_SG/', "

Thank you for watching. I'm really happy to work with a shop I really like! If you are unsure about which sake to get, ask the staffs and they will be happy to suggest you some. I tried 5 sakes and Shinkame Shuzou was my favorite. Huat!!

Sponsored by Kurara.

video_title: We Got A Gift From The Government
video_caption:
['Japanese son and Singaporean mom reviews Singapore NDP (National Day Parade) Fun Pack 2020! Every year, the Singapore government provide citizens with fun packs, usually containing essential goods during the parade like drinks, snacks, Singapore flags and rain coats. Some of you wanted me to review the fun pack, so here it is! 
We have Nation Day in Japan too but most of us treat is like a normal holiday; nothing much goes on. That is why the National Day in Singapore is so exciting and interesting for us.

video_title: Taiwanese Expat's Favorite Thing To Do In Singapore!ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Today, me and my Taiwanese friend James decided to cycle from East Coast Park to Marina Bay Sands. Not many tourists do this, but it's one of the popular activities done by locals. You get this amazing sea view at all times, pass by nice looking cafes/restaurants, and stop by East Coast Lagoon Food Village and get to enjoy delicious local food. (You can watch the food review here - ", 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yjciz...', ")
It took us 87 minutes and the cost for the share bike was 2.86 Singapore dollars. It's really amazing, hope you enjoy it too. Huat AH!!

video_caption:
['I was invited for a filming at the historical Kampong Gelam area in Singapore. I made a vlog about the filming and my interaction with Sheikh Haikel, Singapore's rapper. What an amazing guy!

Here is the link to the video "Sheikh Haikel and Ghib Ojisan: Discover the Flavours of Kampong Gelam"
', 'https://youtu.be/kEkLYNdrVWE', "

Trying new things is scary and the result isn't always great but I'm happy I took part! It was refreshing and so fun. Thank you to the production team of Fyreflyz, Sheikh and Anna Belle! Don't forget to visit Kampong Gelam! The place has so much to offer. I love the diversity and atmosphere there!

video_title: Foreigner Tries Singapore's Most Famous Tau Sar PiahğŸ¥§Loong Fatt
video_caption:
["Loong Fatt (é¾ç™¼è±†æ²™é¤…) is one of Singapore's oldest and most famous kopi tiam (coffee place) selling tau sar piah. The founder first opened his first shop in 1948. That is even before Singapore's independence! 
It's my first time eating this pastry. Is it worth the hype? I traveled to Balestier to find out.

ğŸ˜ƒSubscribeï¼š ", 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', '
ğŸ¥World War 2 Survivor Opened This Shop in SingaporeğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ Balestierï¼š', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-hlTx...', "

Thank you Alvin, Norsaleen and Jiashi from NHB (National Heritage Board) for arranging our appointment. Thank you Xavier and everyone working at Loong Fatt for keep on making these amazing pastries.

Here are more information about NHB's Balestier mini-museum project:
", 'https://www.aspirantsg.com/balestier-...', '

video_caption:
['I finally made it. 500km cycle trip in Hokkaido from Kushiro airport to Sapporo city. What an experience. Bicycle trip is like life. There are LOTS of difficulties and you feel like you want to give up and quit. But when you reach a beautiful location, you feel like all your efforts paid off. 
I encourage you to travel Hokkaido with bicycle. The people, view, and food. Everything is unforgettable.

video_title: Japanese Reviews Singapore's 7-ELEVEN Food! I am Surprised..
video_caption:
["I tried 9 products from Seven Eleven (7-11) in Singapore and here is my review. I'm from Japan, the island of convenience stores, so my tongues are not easy to please. However, after trying all the food, I have to say food at Seven Eleven in Singapore is not bad at all. This was a surprise to me because nobody talks about convenience store food in Singapore. I hope this video was entertaining. Please leave a like if you enjoyed it. Thank you for watching and stay healthy! Huat AH!!

video_caption:
['I'm busking around the world and this is Serbia, my 22nd country.

I played a finger style guitar cover of The Legend Of Ashitaka from the Studio Ghibli film "Princess Mononoke".

I was quite shocked from the amount of tip I got. Thank you, Serbia.']

video_caption:
["Uncle Ghib from Osaka, Japan reviews Singapore's fusion sushi! Local sushi chain Ichibanboshi is offering special National Day menu (available until Aug 23, 2020) and Uncle Ghib who's passionate about Japanese sushi gave it a try. 
He is trying chicken rice sushi, chili crab sushi, popiah sushi, nasi lemak sushi and chye poh sushi. How did he like the sushi? Are they legit? Watch till the end to find out.

Edit: This is not a sponsored video. When my videos are, I always let you know in the video and description box. Huat!

video_title: Japanese Tries To Speak SINGLISH For 24Hrs | NDP2020 SpecialğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
['I'm a Japanese guy living in Singapore, and in today's video, I tried to speak Singlish for 24 hours. Singlish is Singaporeanized English and the two features are: 
1. the use of other languages like Chinese and Malay
2. the speed (so fast that most Japanese will not understand!)

The most popular Singlish term is "can", which can be used in almost every situation.

Q. Here, can? (pointing at an unoccupied seat at food court)
A. Can.

Q. Is it okay if I eat this?
A. Can.

Q. Can meh?
A. Can.

In this video, I tried to use all the popular Singlish phrases for 24 hours. You will also get to see how we enjoyed our NDP (National Day Parade) 2020. Happy birthday Singapore!
Thank you North Bridge Apartments for letting my family stay at your amazing rooms. Watch the full review of the apartment here: ', 'https://youtu.be/9LnNljWyjqQ', '

Thank you Kobayashi-san and JPLUS for interviewing me. Head to Meidiya or Isetan for a hard copy, or you can read it from the link below. 
', 'https://jplus.sg/article/16865/', '

video_title: Foreigner Attempts to Bargain Mao Shan Wang DURIAN!ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
['My flatmates in Singapore had been always taking good care of me, so I thought I should show my gratitude by treating a whole Mao Shan Wang durian. It is considered a treat in Singapore, and my flatmates love it. Watch the video to see a foreigner bargaining durian in this video, and the amazing reaction of my Singaporean flat-mates.

video_title: We (almost) Got Our KeysğŸ  Singapore House-Hunt Finale?
video_caption:
['HDB contacted us to come down, sign documents and receive our keys. Wait... what? Collect our keys? But we thought seller asked for extension. We were a bit confused. So we asked HDB if we will really get the keys but they said "dunno, because the seller didn't go through the proper procedures for extension". We sent a text to the agent but she didn't give us a clear answer. But oh well, let's see if we will get our keys today. Join me on the journey to Singapore's HDB Hub.

video_title: Why Do Japanese Speak Weird English? ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µJapanglish Explained
video_caption:
['So why is it sometimes difficult to understand Japanese person's English? That is because we use Japan-made English (called å’Œè£½è‹±èª Wasei Eigo in Japanese) sometimes. 

- You have no "delicacy"!
- I want to eat "Viking"
- I want to go to "Home"
- I live in a "Mansion"
- I work as a "Aru-baito"

These are only some of the examples. Lots of Japanese still use these weird English terms, so I decided to make this video. If you are moving or traveling to Japan, hopefully you find this helpful.

video_title: My Culture Shock in Japan | USA & Singapore vs Japan
video_caption:
['I am a Japanese raised in the USA and in this video, I talked about my culture shock in Japan. I remember myself kind of struggling in the beginning. I was still young and ignorant, and I only had visited Japan a few times. But then, I eventually got used to the Japanese social etiquettes and was able to enjoy most of my time there. What is your culture shock you had in Japan? Please leave a comment!

video_title: Would You Drink This? Yuan Yuang (Coffee+Tea) at Singapore's Legendary Coffee Shop
video_caption:
['Today I visited one of the oldest coffee shops (kopitiams) in Singapore, Killiney Kopitiam. Their history goes back to when it was first opened by an immigrant from Hainan, China in 1919. I loved the old-school vibe and their not-too-sweet kaya jam. The french loaf kaya toast was something new for me and oh man, it was extremely crunchy and nice. Personally I love visiting these traditional eateries where you can feel the culture and history. Please let me know your favorite kopitiam. I would love to visit more.
Thank you Killiney Kopitiam for hosting me. Check out their newly launched online shop from below. They have a promo going on!
', 'https://killiney-kopitiam.com/collect...', '

video_title: Working Culture in Japan vs Singapore
video_caption:
["Working culture in Japan and Singapore is quite different. Although most people feel like working in Japan is not the best, I do miss our special bonds between colleagues. It's a very special relationship.
However, I was working way too long. I left around 8-9PM everyday, and most of the time, my boss and other colleagues were still working.
Anyways, I hope you like it. Please let me know your thoughts in the comment section below. Huat AH!

video_caption: ['People asked me how I spend my lunch time in Singapore, so here it is.\n\nI basically just order on Grab and eat while editing my videos. Some of my colleagues eat together, but not for me.']

video_caption:
["Enable cc for English subtitles! Today is just a simple vlog about me preparing for CNY 2020 in Singapore. Around 70% are Chinese in this country, so it's one of the biggest holidays here. We don't celebrate Chinese New Year in Japan, so I thought it will be an interesting video for my Japanese viewers. Anyways, have a great new year. May your wishes come true, HUAT AH!

video_title: CB Extended.. Singapore Semi Lockdown DiaryğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has announced yesterday that the circuit breaker will be extended for 4 weeks until June 1st, 2020. One of the reasons is because local transmissions have not decreased. (Plus, there are huge clusters at foreign worker dorimitories)

You can play a part at ", 'https://www.sgpaysitforward.com/', " simply by purchasing a Care Pack for S$25. Each pack is then delivered to those in the community who could do with some kindness. Let's stay safe, and keep positive. I have lots of videos coming out, please subscribe and press the bell icon to receive notifications on my new videos!

", '#SGPAYSITFORWARD', ' is a national movement rallying for individuals to help the vulnerable. I am not sponsored to make this video.

video_caption:
["Who knew Singapore had Little Japan? This place has authentic Japanese cuisine, sweets and products. It's at Jewel Changi Airport, but for some reason, this place can be easily missed. Head to JW360 (#01 - 223, 224, 225) to enjoy Japanese experience without having to leave Singapore.

ğŸ’°Enjoy exclusive discounts until Oct 31st, 2020!
1. Share the video on Facebook
2. Show your Facebook screen with the shared video to the staff at the store

- Sujuu Masayuki: 20% off total bill (Mon-Thu only)
- Cafe: 20% off total bill (Mon-Thu only)
- Nomono: $3 off with minimum $30 spent (Daily) [Use promocode JW360GHIB to enjoy the same discount at Nomono Shopee page (", 'https://shopee.sg/jw360nomono', ')]

This is a sponsored video by JR East Group, but I genuinely recommend it! Everything at JW360 is authentic and delicious. Head off to JW360 if you are missing Japan like I am. Huat!

video_title: LIVE | Which Singapore Hokkien Mee Is The Best? With Secret Guest!
video_caption:
["Tonight, me and a SECRET guest will be trying Singapore's iconic dish, Hokkien Mee! We ordered from 3 stalls and going to compare them. Which one did we like the most? Watch till the end to find out! This video is also streamed on STB Japan's Facebook page.

Hokkien Mee We Are Trying:\xa0
1. Simon Road Hokkien Mee

video_title: Would You Eat This? Singaporean Flatmates Try Japanese NATTO BeansğŸ¤¢
video_caption:
['Today I let my Singaporean flatmates try the most intimidating food in Japan, natto. NattÅ is a traditional Japanese food made from soybeans that have been fermented. It is often served as a breakfast food usually together with rice. I prepared: 
1. normal natto
2. kimchi natto
3. and raw egg with seaweed natto

Do my Singaporean flatmates enjoy natto? Watch till the end to find out!

===

Hey there, I'm a traveling guitarist from Japan. 

I visited this beautiful city called Samarkand in Uzbekistan to play the theme from Final Fantasy X, "To Zanarkand". 

"Samarkand" and "Zanarkand" sounds similar right? It is said that Samarkand became the role model of Zanarkand. It was a beautiful place. A must visit for FFX fans.

video_title: Avoiding Tourist Traps in Osaka - My Local Food Recommendation
video_caption:
['I'm back to Osaka Japan, my home city for new years celebration! I noticed many foreigners only going to the touristy food places, so I decided to make a video about my local recommendation. 

Takoyaki and Okonomiyaki are the top things to eat in Osaka, but there is a curry called "Spice Curryï¼ˆã‚¹ãƒ‘ã‚¤ã‚¹ã‚«ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ï¼‰" originating from Osaka. It's not the ordinary sweet-savoury Japanese curry. Spice Curry uses a mixture of many spices and Japanese ingredients such as tofu, daikon, and Japanese pepper. 
Columbia 8 is my go-to spice curry spot but I also recommend Kitahama Chouji and Taniguchii Curry. Here's the map!

Columbia 8: ', 'https://goo.gl/maps/hESV4w4EXatcGNuD8', '
Chouji: ', 'https://goo.gl/maps/1iNCZn5em8Q619jh8', '
Taniguchi Curry: ', 'https://goo.gl/maps/yZd1vcEoXPtZUkUM7', "

Kushi katsu is also a famous food to eat in Osaka, but I seldom go to the touristy spots like Daruma. (It's not bad, but too crowded and expensive). My personal favorite is Momoï¼ˆç™¾ç™¾ï¼‰ at Umeda. 
It's not the cleanest environment and there is no English menu, but trust me, it's one of the best. If you do not speak Japanese, take a photo of the menu with pictures outside, and show the staff which one you would want to order. Remember, no double-dipping the kushi-katsu sauce!
", 'https://goo.gl/maps/PAW42KT1KSWmASPA7', '

Please like the video is you enjoyed! Thank you.

Subscribe: ', 'http://urx3.nu/HTUJ', '
Where to eat the best Takoyaki: ', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wDoUz...', '
Enquiries:  ', 'https://www.ghib-oji.com/contact/', '

video_title: Should you still come to Singapore? UPDATE
video_caption:
['I received many messages if it is safe to visit Singapore right now. In this video I shared the official data, the situation in the city and how the government and people are dealing. 
In a nutshell, the government is doing a great job tracing the links and keeping us informed of the situation. EVERYDAY they will send you updates about the situation and where the people infected visited. Maybe that is why the citizens are back to the city; they feel calm because the government is providing detailed information everyday.
Most of the tourist attractions are open so you will still be able to enjoy your stay. However, make sure you wash your hands often and try to avoid crowded places. Please wear a mask if you are coughing or having a runny nose. 

Check out the latest updates from the government below:

["Today I visited Tiong Bahru Galicier Pastry, one of Singapore's most popular nonya kueh shops. Nonya kuehs are traditional instagram-worthy Peranakan snacks that can be found in Malaysia, Singapore and Indonesia. I'm a big fan of Bengawansolo and I made my first visit to Galicier. Are they really good? Let's find out together.

video_title: How Itâ€™s Like Joining a LION DANCE Troupe in Singapore!ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬
video_caption:
["Enable cc for English subtitles! Lion Dance Troupe é›·å‹‡ invited me to experience Singapore's traditional culture. Lion Dance is held throughout the year, but becomes most busy on Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year).
The lion, a symbol of power, wisdom, and good fortune, chases away evil spirits and brings hapiness, longevity, and good luck. 

ã€Table of Contentsã€‘
", '1:12', '~ Exploring their secret base
', '7:57', '~ Why Lion Dance is held in Singapore
', '9:54', '~ How much does lion dancers earn?
', '11:38', '~ The best way to get around Singapore | Lion Dance Truck!
', '13:53', '~ The origin of Lion Dance
', '15:13', '~ The meaning of the cabbage (vegetables)
', '16:54', '~ Lion Dance performance

It was such a rare experience to get on the truck and film all the behind-the-scenes. A BIG thank you to Dominic and the members of é›·å‹‡ for welcoming me and letting me experience this culture. 

Check out their facebook page from the link below. You can contact them directly for a quote!
', 'https://www.facebook.com/%E9%9B%B7%E5...', '

video_title: How to Please a Japanese
video_caption:
['How do you make a Japanese happy? How do you please them? Explained in this video. I decided to make this video because some of my viewers are interested in Japanese culture. So here it is. I feel like a lot of the Japanese are curious about how they are seen from other countries. If you can show that you know their culture at a deep level, a lot of them will appreciate that. Please leave a like if you enjoyed the video. Subscribe and turn the bell icon ON to get notifications! Thank you for watching!

video_title: 5 Singaporean Habits I Do NOT Understand
video_caption:
["I'm a Japanese living in Singapore and in this video, I shared about 5 habits I do not understand about this country. 

", '00:18', ' | You must share everything happening to you to the whole world
', '02:46', ' | Kicking the shopping basket
', '04:59', ' | The pronunciation of lettuce
', '07:04', ' | Washing raw meat bought from supermarket
', '08:47', ' | Intense love for bubble tea

There are so many differences between Singapore and Japan and thanks to that, living here is very exciting for me. What are your perspectives on this? Please leave a comment, I would love to hear from you.

video_caption:
["When the news of Punggol Dormitory came in, I was instantly worried about my Bangladeshi bro. He's a migrant worker from Bangladesh and he also lives in a room in a dormitory with 11 other people. Today, I decided to video call him and ask how he's doing.

video_title: A Day in a Life of Norway WWOOFer - Strawberry Farm Volunteer!
video_caption:
["Enable CC for English subtitles! I made this video to show how it's like WWOOFing at a strawberry farm in Tromso, Norway. WWOOF is basically a platform that connects farms looking for volunteers and people who want to experience farming or living at a different environment. 
The farm will provide you accommodation and food in exchange of labor. At this farm, I volunteered around 6 hours a day (5 days a week).
Thank you Roger and all my friends in this video.

The link of the farm:
", 'https://goo.gl/PH3rfJ', '
